intro: Calyptrogyne panamensis subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western Panama calyptrogyne, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface, and it produces small, clustered flowers with two-lipped corollas. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical forests and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
